segments.text: I notice the boy on that wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so far, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe he’s risking a fall just for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is standing right there, waiting for him to hand her one.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re both so focused on those cookies, they don’t even see the water on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’re going to get into so much trouble if that stool falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying dishes, completely unaware of what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’d even hear them if they crashed to the ground.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s balance is so precarious, and he doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn’t hurt himself.
segments.speaker: PAR
